intro: Actimeris, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. Actimeris thrives in warm, humid environments and is often used in ornamental horticulture for its vibrant floral display. Its rapid growth habit makes it suitable for trellises and as a ground cover in shaded areas.
